column4: Hello. I had a jar file on my desktop, somehow i moved it to a folder, i brang it back to desktop, however its become a folder rather than an executable file, and when i option/executable the it wont Check the box. There is also a LOCK emblem on the folder, help please?

Hello. I had a jar file on my desktop, somehow i moved it to a folder, i brang it back to desktop, however its become a folder rather than an executable file, and when i option/executable the it wont Check the box. There is also a LOCK emblem on the folder, help please?
open a terminal, and then use the "cd" command to get to where the JAR file is. From there, type sudo chown yourusername:yourusername filename.jar
okay, put the file onto your desktop
then, in the terminal, type "cd ~/Desktop" but without the quotes
okay, with the file in the desktop and after typing cd ~/Desktop, type "sudo chown yourusername:yourusername" replacing yourusername with whatever your user name is.
you should be in ~/Desktop, or /home/yourusername/Desktop; both are equivalent
again, move the JAR file onto your desktop, then in the terminal type "cd ~/Desktop". After that, type "sudo chown yourname:yourname filename.jar"
after doing that, you should be able to then type "
after doing that, you should be able to then type "chmod +x filename.jar"
sudo chown namename,  chmod +x done
try running your jar file as you did previously. This should have solved your problem.
it has wont execute, and will not let to option execute it.. will try some things
does folder access matter? they are all on access files
a JAR file should either execute or open as an archive...are you saying it's opening in the file browser?
could not find main class. also if i double click the folder will open with files
there is also a lock symbol on my folder. guessing that is read only, though its not checked
yes, that would normally mean read-only. Your permissions tab should have it listed as Read and Write for you and your group
when i switch around folder access, file access, to read and write it will go back wont stay. files access will return to ...
I think that's a visual glitch. It should still stick. To make sure, open that terminal, go back to the Desktop, and type ls -al. There will be a string of letters to the left of the jar's file name.
thats odd. its listing  a .jar and a .jar(2)
wow, that's new. would you mind posting the full output on the pastebin website and showing me?
dont mind, will get
Thanks for help, resolved problem!
